Expectation1: Design and develop technical solutions to meet project requirements
Situation1: The build is stalled because no one can proceed until their core module is complete
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They recognize the importance of being present at weekly services regularly
Story:
I stared at the blinking cursor on my screen, the code for the core module half-finished. The project manager’s message echoed in my mind: “We can’t move forward until your part is done.” I knew the team was waiting, their progress stalled, and the deadline loomed closer with every passing hour. As an engineer, I felt the weight of responsibility pressing down on me—my work was the linchpin for everyone else.

But then my phone buzzed with a reminder: Sunday service in an hour. I remembered the warmth of the congregation, the sense of belonging, and the peace I found in worship. As a Christian, I believed in honoring God with my time, in being present for my church family, and in nurturing my faith through regular attendance.

My heart pounded as I glanced between the unfinished code and my Bible on the desk. I felt torn, pulled by the urgent demands of my profession and the quiet, persistent call of my faith. The clock ticked on, and I sat there, wrestling with the impossible choice between my duty to my team and my commitment to my spiritual life.
